title: Add ability to mint an NFT based on score (https://replit.com/@jgrinnell0/cryptoforwardalpha?v=1)
description:
Users who connect to the dapp should be able to mint their scores as a non-transferrable NFT which displays their score. Here's an example: https://mintkudos.xyz/community/LearnWeb3?tab=Kudos&tokenId=14597

Acceptance Criteria
: there should be a button in the UI that allows users to mint a non-transferrable NFT on Polygon, after a user has connected their wallet and shown their score
: the non-transferrable NFT should have a consistent, clean design, and display the users' score and ETH/Polygon address

#code
Use the code/repo here, fork it, and send me the code you write: https://replit.com/@jgrinnell0/cryptoforwardalpha?v=1
author: jgrinnell0

title: ‚åöÔ∏è Apple Watch Compass App (Orientation Based Vibration) [Swift]
description:
Trying to see the possibility of an Apple Watch app that notifies (vibration) the user when they are facing North. That's all. No need for other features. No connection to phone/internet.

It would (I believe) primarily use this feature: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coremotion/cmmagnetometerdata/1616084-magneticfield

And would use the Apple Watch 5 and Later for magnometer (compass) feature.

MVP: If user's wrist is facing 'north', slightly vibrate for 1s.

Acceptance Criteria
MVP or potential for MVP.
A TestFlight ready app that vibrates for 1s when the user faces North each time.
e.g. I walk and turn east, no vibration
I keep waking and turn north, slight 1s vibration.
I turn west, no vibration.
I turn north again, 1s vibration.
author: Bandos1000

title: Create a modal in react using the UX mockup provided.
description:
Create a modal in react js using the UX mockup provided
Image Grid - A vertically scrollable list of images. The backend api will be provided to you. On hover each image should show an enlarge/preview icon, which should show just the image in another full screen modal

New Images Button - When this button is clicked, an api request must be made, the 'New Images Grid' should show a loader while the api request is being processed. When the api request is complete, the  grid should show the returned images as a 2*2 grid. The backend api will be provided.

This is primarily a design job , so in addition to the UX, a good looking UI also needs to be implemented.

mockup - https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SlQCEoTEp6xOCregwVJLt2744nt4rGcb/view?usp=sharing
Acceptance Criteria
All the functionality as mentioned needs to be tested and completed.
author: mahendranaik

title: üìä Basic Front End + DataPull for RuneScape competition
description:
Trying to create an epic website to see the status of the Speedrun competition in OSRS.
I've made a quick frame of it here: https://www.figma.com/file/3anndl61BWgpo0Kpzewhpr/OSRS-Proj?node-id=1%3A2&t=VYyI0mIMSQzxnqh4-1

Ideally, would work on Mobile and Web. Not sure what the best way to build this is.
I'll need to manually enter the:
Speedrunner names
Speedrunner Youtube/Twitch channels

The most challenging aspect is pulling a iframe from https://wiseoldman.net with a selected username: https://wiseoldman.net/players/phonk%20addict
And only displaying the stats section (as seen in Figma)

I think there are 2-6 right now. I would like the ability to add more speed runners in the future.
Acceptance Criteria
A stunning website to see who is currently winning/speedrunning OSRS. I will connect a custom domain after delivery.
I have no problem with crediting you/linking your Replit profile on the site.
author: Bandos1000

title: GPT3 AI Story Video Generator
description:
I would like to create a tool that can create Story Videos based on prompts. It can be a simple command line tool, no need for a website or app.

User inputs story prompt (ex. A story about a girl and a big mountain)
Story is given to GPT-3 API, in a way so that it gives the story text and descriptions of images for the story (to be used by DALLE-2)
Image prompts from GPT-3 output will be fed to DALLE-2 API (or a different image generating AI)
Story is read by Text-To-Speech API (for ex. Azure Cognitive Services)
Audio and Images are combined to create a single video using the https://remotion.dev library.

Basically, the tool should be written in JavaScript, retrieve data from all the required APIs, and use the Remotion library to create a video from these outputs.

I am a coder myself who has used all these API's and libraries before, and I can provide support if you need any help.
author: CoderGautamYT

title: AI Story Video Generator Tool
description:
I would like to create a tool that can create Story Videos based on prompts. It can be a simple command line tool, no need for a website or app.

User inputs story prompt (ex. A story about a girl and a big mountain)
Story is given to GPT-3 API, in a way so that it gives the story text and descriptions of images for the story (to be used by DALLE-2)
Image prompts from GPT-3 output will be fed to DALLE-2 API (or a different image generating AI)
Story is read by Text-To-Speech API (for ex. Azure Cognitive Services)
Audio and Images are combined to create a single video using the Remotion library.

Basically, the tool should be written in JavaScript, retrieve data from all the required APIs, and use the Remotion library to create a video from these outputs.

I am a coder myself who has used all these API's and libraries before, and I can provide support if you need any help.

title: Build a benchmarker for NFT APIs / RPCs
description:
Many new companies have built NFT indexers that exist to reliably serve data on digital assets in a fast, Web2 performant way. Unfortunately, many of them do not actually hold up to these claims. This bounty should build a way to benchmark those APIs on a frontend.

Acceptance Criteria
NextJS frontend
Ability to spawn {X} random NFTs that are served from {Y} endpoint
Compare network payloads, response times, and cost per call

Services:
straight RPC calling of Shadowdrive / Arweave
Pinata
Lollipop.xyz

Can use libraries like https://github.com/grafana/k6

title: Clojure query for Roam: number of [[POMO]] per day

description:
Make financial data easily accessible

Acceptance Criteria

author: GennaroCuofano

title: Build a webapp that uses GPT-3 to execute a series of actions on the web through Playwright
description:
Essentially we are looking for a web app version of the Natbot:
https://github.com/nat/natbot

Acceptance Criteria
Design the front end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and the backend using Python and the Flask framework.

The Web app is basically a simple Title (GPT Browser Actions) and a textfield input for the prompt. The following prompts should work:
"Search google for the best hotels around me"
Result: A new browser page is opened, goes to google.com, enters best hotels around me, all based on GPT3 providing playwright code to execute as in the example of Natbot
"Search Paris on Google Maps"
Result: A new browser page is opened, goes to maps.google.com, searches Paris
author: mrock3

title: React-Table / Similar to Monday.com
description:
I'm the founder of mapsheet.com and I am trying to help my engineers test and build new features faster. Our software is quite complicated now so I want a parallel environment where I can explore ideas and features without getting in the way.
Acceptance Criteria
A spreadsheet built in react-table where the cells in each column are a specific data type (number, currency, date, short text, date, address etc) with the following columns:
Address column pinned/frozen to the far left
Short text column
Short text column
Date column
Currency column
Number column
Number column
Currency column

Additionally, please include the following features:
resizable column widths
drag & drop to rearrange column order
add a new column and set column type as date, number, currency, or short text

A live preview of the changes are shown to the user, with a watermark/url o...

author: atlasxbeaumont

title: Web app that will generate recipes using AI
description:
I am looking to develop a simple web app that allows users to generate recipes with the help of AI.

The web app should allow users to submit a recipe name, hit generate, and have an AI return a step-by-step guide to produce the recipe.

There should also be additional, optional fields for users to enter:
Number of servings desired
Dietary restrictions
Preferences

Also to be included is an additional tick box labelled 'Surprise me' which will prompt the AI to add a surprise additional ingredient.

Acceptance Criteria:
Front end and design that is simple and focuses on the form for the user to submit information
Users have access to a responsive, clean form and can enter recipe name, dietary restrictions, preferences, etc.
The web app successfully generates a response with a step-by-step recipe with criteria matching the user's preferences
author: stanbm

title: LinkedIn analytics in Python
description:
I am the Super Admin of a company LinkedIn page & want to import all my data using the LinkedIn API in Python to enable my own data analysis. The data I need is: engagement data on every post, follower data & page visits for a given date range.

Acceptance Criteria
Given a company id (e.g. 1234), date range (e.g. 01/01/22 - 31/12/22) I can call a script that saves down into three different csv's the above data ie posts.csv, followers.csv & visitors.csv
Assume user has full administrative access to the page & the application development tier is 'Marketing Developer Platform' (ie clientid & clientsecret will have correct permissions)
The script will enable 3-legged OAuth needed to extract certain data https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/linkedin/shared/authentication/authorization-code-flow?context=linkedin%2Fcontext&tabs=HTTPS1

title: Discord Bot + Replit Status Page Integration
description:
Whenever I update the replit status page, it's annoying to have to post in discord what we just posted on the status page.  I want a discord bot that checks the replit status page at an interval of once per five minutes and posts every time there's an update or an incident.

Acceptance Criteria
The discord bot should post an embed at every update only if something changes.
As stated above, the discord bot should check the status page at an interval of once every five minutes.  For more information on how to use the api to access the status of replit, check out this repl.
The embed message should display the following information:
 Status (investigating, resolved, etc)
 Title
 Description
 Time when the status page was last updated
 The title of the embed should link to the status page (https://status.replit.com)
 Domain / Area affected (replit.com, repl.co, blog.replit.com, etc)
 Time between current incident and the last incident
When an incident's status is update...

title: $1000 for best 140-second AI film on Satoshi Nakamoto
description:
Hollywood is not going to tell an accurate story about Bitcoin when they finally make the Satoshi movie, so we as a decentralized community of creators must tell it ourselves. Instead of doing a 140 minute film using a studio, let‚Äôs create a 140 second film about Satoshi Nakamoto using AI.

Acceptance Criteria
Must be around 140 seconds (+/- 10 sec).
Must be created with AI
Must be about Satoshi Nakamoto
Must tell a story with a beginning, middle, and end.
Must reply to tweet (https://twitter.com/patrickwstanley/status/1610345715737464832?s=46&t=IBFj6XibJAETsBtV0YmA) by 1/31/23 to qualify

title: Specifications Grading Tool
description:
Simplify grading entire classes through a single-page interface connected to profiles that can be updated and exported/printed.

Acceptance Criteria
A single page with a search or drop-down menu that calls up individual student profiles below.
An option nearby for adding new student profiles.
In each profile five categories/sections are present:
   Three equally prominent categories/sections labelled "Bundle A", "Bundle B" and "Bundle C".
   A fourth category/section of equal size but less prominence labelled "Bundle D".
   A fifth category/section labelled "Tokens".

In the first four sections there should be an option to "Add an assessment" where a simple title can be input with text (or preselected from recently used options). When added to that section, each assessment should be able to be toggled between "below standard", "to standard" or "to standard with distinction".  A final click box should be available with "removed" as an option, if clicked the assessmen...
author: T-WW

title: Workflowy-esque AI Todo list expander
description:
Sometimes a particular task can be daunting, leading to procrastination. An effective solution is to break the task down into a number of simpler, more approachable subtasks. If any of those tasks are still intimidatingly, they can be further subdivided.

Workflowy.com pioneered an infinitely nestable outline interface which is conducive to this type of task subdivision. This bounty is to create a prototype app which improves upon Workflowy by using a LLM to assist in task subdivision.

Acceptance Criteria
 A workflowy-esque webapp, with an intuitive UI allowing the user to build an infinitely nestable outline.
 A function which automatically creates nested subtasks for any given task by using an LLM, such as GPT3
 Your choice of web framework
author: dougfeig

title: Build custom excel report that gets external data from various advertising and ecommerce platforms
description:

Acceptance Criteria
An automated report using Microsoft Excel Power Query (or other) to import, combine data from multiple sources and shape it into a daily report format I have created.

title: Endpoint that gets URL of a file and saves it in Google Drive

URL of a file to download (files will be audio or video, so most likely hundreds of MBs in size
Google Drive Folder ID to store the file in
Google Drive token

Acceptance Criteria

This can be implemented in GCP or AWS, in Python or JS.

The endpoint will download the file from the URL, and upload it to the Google Drive folder given in the parameters, using the token provided in the parameters.

-- If the Google Drive authentication fails, the function will return an HTTP error code
--  If the download fails to complete, the function will return an HTTP error code
-- If the upload to Google Drive fails to complete, the function will return an HTTP error code

title: Podcast screenshot reader - Coded in Python
description:
Using Python code, we need to be able to read a screenshot taken on a phone when someone is listening to a podcast and extract the left most time stamp e.g., 5:15.  Then turn this  time into a number of seconds (in this case 60*5 plus 15 = 315) into the podcast when they screenshot was taken.
We also want to extract and read the date of the podcast and as much of the text of the podcast title as is visible in the screenshot.

Acceptance Criteria

Python code which can execute the above task accurately on 10 podcast screenshots , which we will supply.

Technical Details

author: YorkvilleDS

title: Help explore how to train a custom fine tuned model for re-creating consistent scenarios in my cartoon from different camera angles
description:
First, you will need to gather a dataset of images or video frames that represent the different camera angles of the scenarios you want to recreate. This dataset should contain a variety of different angles, including close-ups, wide shots, high angles, low angles, etc.

Preprocess your dataset by cropping, resizing, and/or normalizing the images or video frames as needed.

Split your dataset into training and validation sets. The training set will be used to train your model, while the validation set will be used to evaluate the model's performance during training.

Choose a deep learning model architecture that is suitable for your task. There are many different architectures to choose from, such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) or recurrent neural networks (RNNs).

Fine-tune the chosen model on your training set by adjusting the model's hyperparameters and training it for a number of epochs. You may want to use a technique like transfer learning to make the training process m...

title: "Koi Pond" Interface for Aphorisms
description:

https://replit.com/@Dprevoznik/Aphorisms?v=1

I would like someone to update the existing "/" index page, so that the Aphorism tiles float in from any direction of the screen and float out from another direction. Once they have all floated out of the screen, the "/random-aphorisms" endpoint should be called so that the screen is endlessly filled with aphorism tiles. The tiles should randomly enter from one side of the screen (left, right, top, bottom) and exit out of another side of the screen (left, right, top, bottom) in a straight line.

Questions?

title: AI based resume sorter

title: Dream Studio API text to image +  vertical marketplace to buy/sell commercialize the physical versions
description:
Text to image generation for physical products is a great tool for inspiration but does not yield production ready design (except possibly for printed products.) For other products (like a shoe for example), professionals are needed, such as traditional product and CAD designers and factory producers.

My idea is a website that will be a 2 way marketplace to bridge the gap between inspirational designs created by amateurs and pros alike, and the professionals and producers who can turn those designs into reality. AI designs created by anyone can be offered on the site for sale as either concepts, production ready, or actually produced, with the proceeds divided among those involved in bringing them to life.

It will be somewhat similar to a dribbble.com, artstation.com, or an unsplash.com, but instead of the offerings being created offsite and uploaded, the image creation will take place on our site via dreamstudio api.

This site will allow anyone, with no (industr...

title: Chrome extension with google login and api integations
description:
A chrome extensions needs to be developed. It will have  to support google login. There are essentially two screens in the extension.
Screen 1 - If the user isn't logged in then a login with google prompt needs to be shown

Screen 2 - When the user is logged in, two textboxes and a dropdown with a CTA will be shown.
On clicking the CTA the data from one of the textboxes need to be sent to an api and the response must be added to the other textbox.
And when the api is being processed, all the elements in the UI need to be disabled.
The backend api will be provided.
Also, design is paramount here, there will be design feedback which  will need to be implemented.

Acceptance Criteria
All the mentioned cases need to pass and the chrome extensions needs to be published to the store successfully.

description:
Noodle is a platform for experts to sell their expertise in the form of chat or in person sessions.

Availability UI - Webpage & components built per the design that allows an expert to create available time blocks.

Technical Details
Frontend - React, Typescript, Next.js
Backend - Node.js, Express
Database - Postgres, TypeORM

title: Parse a Structured PDF report.
description:
Our users have to digest a long PDF data report to extract a few pieces of information and make simple addition calculations to complete another task.  We have a Bubble application that utilizes Xano database where the users currently upload and store this pdf report, open it, read it, find the relevant fields, make the manual calculations and then complete their task.  This program should parse and provide the relevant fields as well as the calculated fields.

Sample PDF:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BDwaWXlWF7Yz0LeI3kpE4sBKJnFEV_9T/view?usp=sharing

Acceptance Criteria
The program should have an api to receive the report from Bubble, parse the data and store it in a way that individual fields can be called, and an api to return the needed fields to Bubble.
author: FrankieSoriano

title: Virtual Muslim Prayer App
description:
Here is a brief outline of how the app could work:

The user selects their current location or enters a custom location.
The app displays the current local prayer times and the names of the prayers (Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha).
The user can choose to join a virtual prayer session with other users or pray individually.
If the user chooses to join a virtual prayer session, the app shows a list of nearby mosques and their prayer times. The user can select a mosque to join the prayer session at the designated time.
If the user chooses to pray individually, they can select a prayer from the list and the app will provide an audio recording of the prayer in Arabic with English translation.
The app also includes a feature to set reminders for the daily prayer times.

Acceptance Criteria
The app should have a functional sign up and login system
The app should accurately display the Qibla direction for the user's location
The app should display a Hadith or Quranic verse ...
author: Sarfrazkhan18

title: Create a Sign-in Component
description:
Business Value
I want a sign-in component that allows users to connect to my platform using different authentication methods.

Acceptance Criteria

AC0: The sign-in in the component must be done in the front-end using React and in the backend with Python (ideally using Django)
AC1: The sign-in displays three different authentication methods:
Social login using Twitter, Google, and Apple
Passwordless email
Connect Wallet (Metamask, Coinbase Wallet, Wallet Connect)

AC2: Given a user authenticates for the first time (so registering) using the Social Login, or passwordless email, then a wallet is created using a custodial wallet API (will define and give Access to the API to create this wallet)
AC3:  The exact authentication flow will be sent as a Figjam draw in Discord
AC4: The UI/UX will be sent as a Figma Prototype in Discord

author: lakshman111

title: Amazon product reviews summary
description:
I am planning to see how we can apply OpenAI for say better understanding the voice of a customer and reduce my time to read through myriad of reviews on Amazon.  I need working code and UI based in Python with a simple input interface.

Acceptance Criteria
A. Create a simple page where the user adds an Amazon product detail page URL as the input. The URL will be in a format such as https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08NG8WFX5/ where B08NG8WFX5 is the product (called "ASIN").
B. From this ASIN, scrap all of Amazon's reviews. Reviews can be found on a separate page such as https://www.amazon.com/product-reviews/B08NG8WFX5/.
C. Use OpenAI to analyze the reviews.
D. Summarize the reviews in a specified word length, input by the user (e.g., 200 words or even 20 words).
E. Summarize reviews in specific groups with strengths and weaknesses.

title: Pulling some data using simfin api
description:
I need someone to use the simfin.com API to create a backtesting app for suggested portfolios. E.g., I can set conditions (P/E lower than 10, and FCF higher than $500m etc), set a date (10th of March 2018), and be able to get a list of stocks + their purchase prices. For extra credit I'd love for the purchase basket (all the stocks defined above) to be rebalanced at defined intervals (monthly/ quarterly/ yearly) if chosen.

Acceptance Criteria
Ability to input the defined criteria as above and get a table with the results.

title: MVP web app for students to submit screen/webcam recordings of flashcard reviews
description:
We'd like to create a basic web app that allows teachers to create sets of 2-sided digital "flashcards" and assign them to students; and then allows students to submit a combination screen recording/webcam recording of themselves reviewing the flashcards. The recording should show both what the student is seeing on the screen as the student navigates through the cards (click on a card to show the other side; then click a button to see the next card); and also the student's webcam view as he/she states the answers to questions out loud.

Acceptance Criteria
Account creation for teachers (who can create flashcards)
Account creation for students (who can view flashcards)
Ability of teachers to assign a set of flashcards to a student
Ability of students to see the assignment
Ability of students to record a flashcard review and submit it to teacher
Notification for teachers when an assignment is submitted
Whatever infrastructure is needed to support video storage
